intro: Petalactella woodii, commonly known as the Wood's petalactella, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are typically pink or white with five petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to survive.
